a.title: School Board Agenda and Minutes Archives
a.span: School Board Agenda and Minutes Archives

li.a: School Board Agenda and Minutes Archives

div.p: Weld Re-3J Schools will be closed for in-person instruction for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.
Creating opportunities for student success through a safe learning environment, rigorous instruction, diverse activities, and an engaged community.

span.style: font-size: 20px;

hr.p:
Cindy Baumgartner, President—District C (2021)
Fred Jensen, Secretary—District B (2021)
Erin Grundy, Vice President—District A (2021)
Deb Gustafson, Treasurer—District E (2019)
Vacant, TBD—District D (2019)

a.title: Click here for Enrollment in Weld RE3J

span.style: background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245); font-size: 10pt;
background-color: rgb(245, 245, 245);

p.strong:
2,550+ students in Pre-K through 12th grades
4 elementary schools, 1 charter, 1 middle, and 1 high school
Respectful and motivated student population
Experienced and energetic teaching and support staff
Technology-rich environments
Newer and remodeled school facilities
Located just northeast of the Denver-metro area

span.style: color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

p.style: font-family: -webkit-standard; -webkit-text-size-adjust: auto; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; text-align: center;

div.div: Weld County School District Re-3J is currently requesting bids for a Food Service Management Company.
Enroll a NEW Student, Kindergarten-12th for the current school year AND for the 2020-2021 school year!!!
It's Preschool Registration Time for 2020-2021 School Year! Preschool registration for the 2020-2021 school year is open beginning Tuesday, January 7, 2020.
Financial & Capital Update Please view our community newsletter highlighting district finances, capital construction updates progress, and strategic plan goal progress.
Check it out!!!The current Infinite Campus app will be retiring soon! A new Infinite Campus app has been released for parent and student use!!!
Parent, Students, Staff! Our NEW Weld RE-3J App is HERE!

span.style: background: white; font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: "Segoe UI", sans-serif; color: rgb(102, 102, 102);

p.span: The United States 2020 Census is coming this spring. Be in the know about how the census helps our community. Timeline. By April 1, 2020, every home will receive an invitation to participate in the 2020 Census in an easy and safe way.

span.style: font-size: 16pt; font-family: "Segoe UI Light", sans-serif; color: black;

h1.span: Pride in Re-3J: District Releases Video of Schools

span.style: text-size-adjust: auto; font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.span: The $61 million voter approved bond, as well as additional funds such as interest income, energy rebates, and competitive grants, total over $70 million in construction projects for Re-3J students. As we near completion of this intensive two year process, all schools and facilities will have been touched by the Bond Program. Many of you have seen the new and renovated schools firsthand. The district is now releasing a

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-east-asian: normal; text-decoration-line: underline; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(17, 85, 204);
text-size-adjust: auto; font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial;

p.span: which showcases each of our schools, highlights of the major renovations, and the programs available to students.

h1.hr:
Greg A. Rabenhorst, Ed.D.
Superintendent's Message:

div.h2: Welcome to Weld RE3J School District!

p.style: font-size: 15px; line-height: 19.5px; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(53, 50, 49); background-color: rgb(238, 232, 230);
font-size: 15px; line-height: 19.5px; font-family: arial, sans-serif; color: rgb(53, 50, 49); background-color: rgb(238, 232, 230);

span.style: font-size: 16px;

p.span: We are thankful for the support of parents and community members. We are committed to timely communication and leading by listening, both at the school and district levels. We know you are busy and that it’s not always easy to get involved. That’s why we continue to use Let’s Talk as an online communication and customer service platform. Simply click on the Contact Us or Let’s Talk button at re3j.com to submit a question, comment, concern, suggestion, or compliment. We commit to providing a timely response from the most direct source possible. This option is not intended to replace direct phone, email, or in-person contact!
